sen.j: 奈良 専二（なら せんじ、1822年−1892年5月4日）は、香川県出身の老農（篤農家）・農業指導者。
sen.e: Senji NARA (1822 - May 4, 1892) was an exemplary farmer and agricultural advisor, who was born in Kagawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治農法を確立した「明治の三老農」の一人として知られる。
sen.e: Nara is known as the "three best exemplary farmers of Meiji Period," who developed and established the agricultural methods in Japan.

sen.j: 1822年、讃岐国三木郡池戸村（いけのべむら、現・香川県木田郡三木町大字池戸）の農家、奈良才蔵の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: NARA was born in Ikebeno-mura Village, Miki District, Sanuki Province (currently Ohji Ikebe, Miki-cho, Kita District, Kagawa Prefecture) in 1822, as the eldest son of a farmer, Saizo NARA.
NARA was born in Ikenobe-mura Village, Miki District, Sanuki Province (currently Oaza Ikenobe, Miki-cho, Kita District, Kagawa Prefecture) in 1822, as the eldest son of a farmer, Saizo NARA.
sen.cmt: Ikebeno-mura→スペルミスのためIkenobe-muraに訂正しました。Ohji Ikebe→Oaza Ikenobeに訂正しました。http://www.post.japanpost.jp/cgi-zip/zipcode.php?pref=37&city=1373410&id=136363参照しました。
sen.e: NARA was born in Ikenobe-mura Village, Miki District, Sanuki Province (currently Oaza Ikenobe, Miki-cho, Kita District, Kagawa Prefecture) in 1822, as the eldest son of a farmer, Saizo NARA.

sen.j: 幼少のころから「農をもって国を興す」という大志を抱き、わずか8歳で運搬用の手押し車を発明するなど農機具の考案、さらにはイネの品種改良など農業全般にわたる実地指導者として活躍した。
sen.e: He had an ambition to "promote the national development of Japan through the development of agriculture" from his childhood; he invented an agricultural instrument--a handcart to carry agricultural produces--when he was only 8 years old; he continued to work practically as the leading advisor of various agricultural fields, including the improvement and production of new rice variety.

sen.j: 1883年、60歳を過ぎて決意を新たに上京。
sen.e: In 1883, he moved to Tokyo when he was in his 60's, with a new determination of dedicating himself to the development of agriculture.

sen.j: 以来、東京府、千葉県、茨城県の各地で農業技術の研究を行うとともに、指導者としても活躍した。
sen.e: Since then, he worked on the studies of agricultural techniques and technology in Tokyo, Chiba and Ibaraki Prefectures, while he also passed on his knowledge to following farmers as an advisor of agricultural methods.

sen.j: 1890年、秋田県仙北郡花館村（現・大仙市）に農業指導者として招聘された。
sen.e: In 1890, he was offered a post as an agricultural advisory from Hanadate Village, Senboku District, Akita Prefecture.
In 1890, he was offered a post as an agricultural advisory from Hanadate Village, Senboku District, Akita Prefecture (currently Daisen City).

sen.j: 花館村に移住し、豪農・佐々木多右衛門家に滞在しながら、「働かなければ生活はできない」という勤労の気風を植えつけた。
sen.e: He moved to Hanadate Village and stayed at the house of a large farmer of the village, Taemon SASAKI; he planted the spirit of labour to the local farmers that "the lives of us can not be sustained without serious labour."

sen.j: ウサギの生産・養蚕・馬産を奨励、さらに納豆、豆腐の製法も教え、乾田での馬耕も指導、着々と成果をあげた。
sen.e: He steadily achieved results--he encouraged to stock breeding rabbits and horses, raise silkworms, while he also gave instructions on how to produce natto (fermented soybeans) and tofu, (bean curd) and the plow method of a dry rice field utilizing horse power.

sen.j: また、数々の農書を著した。
sen.e: He also left many writings on the themes of agriculture in general.

sen.j: 耕地整理も奈良の指導で仙北郡内で最初に行われ、今日の農業の礎を築いた。
sen.e: The first redevelopment of arable land was operated in Senboku District under the instruction of NARA, which laid the foundation of modern agriculture in Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文で、「奈良の指導方法」が今日の農業の礎を築くことになったのか、近代的な「耕地整理」というものがこれをきっかけに行われるようになったために今日の農業の礎を築く事になったのか、この文章では読み取れません。よって直訳にとどめています。

sen.j: 1892年5月4日、秋田県南秋田郡川尻村（現・秋田市）で肺炎のため死亡した。
